CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 35 On the other hand , Li and co-workers employed the difluoro-substituted thiopheneconjugated side chain to construct bi(alkyl-difluorothienyl)benzodithiophene-fluorobenzotriazole copolymer J91 , which was shown to exhibit superior cell performance than that of the Article nonfluorinated control polymer.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. Li - This is a proper noun, referring to the researcher or group of researchers who conducted the study.
2. difluoro-substituted thiopheneconjugated side chain - This is a chemical compound, specifically a type of side chain that is attached to a polymer backbone.
3. bi(alkyl-difluorothienyl)benzodithiophene-fluorobenzotriazole copolymer J91 - This is a chemical compound, specifically a type of conjugated polymer that is the subject of the study.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. difluoro-substituted thiopheneconjugated side chain
2. bi(alkyl-difluorothienyl)benzodithiophene-fluorobenzotriazole copolymer J91

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 35 On the other hand , Li and co-workers employed the difluoro-substituted thiopheneconjugated side chain to construct bi(alkyl-difluorothienyl)benzodithiophene-fluorobenzotriazole copolymer J91 , which was shown to exhibit superior cell performance than that of the Article nonfluorinated control polymer.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's break down the entities mentioned in the paragraph related to "Property Value":

1. "Property Value" - This is the general term used to refer to the value of a property or a characteristic of an entity.
2. "cell performance" - This refers to the ability of a solar cell to convert sunlight into electrical energy, which is a property value that is important in the context of solar cells.
3. "Article nonfluorinated control polymer" - This is a reference to a polymer that does not contain fluorine atoms, which is used as a control in a comparison with the copolymer J91.
4. "copolymer J91" - This is a specific polymer that is constructed by combining difluoro-substituted thiophene and conjugated side chains, which is the focus of the study.
5. "superior cell performance" - This is a property value that is compared to the performance of the control polymer, indicating that the copolymer J91 has better performance in terms of converting sunlight into electrical energy.

So, the entities related to "Property Value" in the paragraph are:

* cell performance
* Article nonfluorinated control polymer
* copolymer J91

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities related to the value of material properties that are mentioned in the paragraph:

1. "cell performance" - This refers to the ability of a solar cell to convert sunlight into electrical energy, which is a material property.
2. "copolymer J91" - This is a specific polymer that is constructed by combining difluoro-substituted thiophene and conjugated side chains, which is the focus of the study.
3. "superior cell performance" - This is a property value that is compared to the performance of the control polymer, indicating that the copolymer J91 has better performance in terms of converting sunlight into electrical energy.

So, the entities related to the value of material properties in the paragraph are:

* cell performance
* copolymer J91
* superior cell performance
